org.edg.data.replication.optorsim

Class JobHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.JobHandler

  • public class JobHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the flow of jobs into a ComputingElement using a queueing system. It provides the methods for communication between the ResourceBroker and ComputingElement threads.

    Copyright (c) 2002 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

    Since:
    JDK1.4

    • Constructor Detail

      • JobHandler

        public JobHandler(int queueLimit)

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public GridJob get()
        The method called by the ComputingElement to obtain a job from the resource broker. If the job queue is empty the ComputingElement thread waits until the ResourceBroker calls put().
        Returns:
        The first GridJob in the queue.

      • put

        public boolean put(GridJob gridJob)
        The method called by the ResourceBroker to give a job to the ComputingElement. The job is added to the end of the job queue unless the queue is full.
        Returns:
        true if job was successfully submitted, false if the job queue is full.

      • interruptJobHandler

        public void interruptJobHandler()
        Method called by the ResourceBroker at the end of the simulation to interrupt waiting ComputingElements so their threads will end.

      • getQueueSize

        public int getQueueSize()
        Returns:
        The current queue size.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns:
        True if queue is full, false if not.

      • getQueueAccessCost

        public double getQueueAccessCost(Optimisable optor,
                        ComputingElement ce)
        Calculate the cost of running all the jobs queued at the given ComputingElement. Some optimisation is performed by storing the cost of each job, then if the same job appears again in the queue the stored cost is used instead of calculating it again. This assumes the state of the Grid does not change during this method.

      • jobCount

        public int jobCount()
        Find out the job count
        Returns:
        number of jobs that have either been processed or are being processed.

      • putFirst

        public boolean putFirst(GridJob gridJob)
        The method called by the WorkerNode to reinsert a job to the ComputingElement. The job is added to the begin of the job queue unless the queue is full.
        Returns:
        true if job was successfully submitted, false if the job queue is full.

      • isEndOfJobs

        public boolean isEndOfJobs()
        Returns:
        false if there are still job that can come, otherwise true
